We summarise these results in the following Key Point:

Key Point

A function \(f(t)\) with period \(2\pi\) has a Fourier series

\[ f(t) = \dfrac{a_0}{2} + \sum_{n=1}^\infty (a_n \cos nt + b_n \sin nt) \] The Fourier coefficients are

\[ \begin{align} a_n &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int _{-\pi}^\pi } f(t) \cos nt \hspace{0.15cm} dt \hspace{1cm} n = 0, 1, 2, \dots \\ b_n &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int _{-\pi}^\pi } f(t) \sin nt \hspace{0.15cm} dt \hspace{1cm} n = 1, 2, \dots \end{align} \] In the integrals any convenient integration range extending over an interval of \(2\pi\) may be used.
